topics.body:
OH MY GOD
I JUST REALIZED WHY NONE OF THE ORIGINAL GUNMEN HAVE PROPER HEADS
[spoiler]The spiral king was trying to stop the generation of spiral energy, right? And isn't it mentioned at some point that the human form is optimal for generating spiral energy? Thus you can't have a bunch of human shaped robots running around or else some humans might get their hands on them and create craptons of spiral energy![/spoiler]

or maybe it just looked cool
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

For what I understand, being a Mangaka is considered an actual career choice but parents still advice their children to take other classes as a back-up because it's still a very risky one to choose.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5494f6916368725312080100#post_5494f6916368725312080100
Didn't Eiichiro Oda become a manga-ka because, and I quote, "I didn't want to get a real job"?
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5494f6e7636872731ca80000#post_5494f6e7636872731ca80000

That's more a personal view if he's not just joking.

When you do what you love and better yet, it becomes something that has had an impact on peoples lives like in this particular case, of course you won't think that counts as a job because you love doing it so much it stops being an obligation.
